Veratis watched the words appear on the screen. "She is amazing, 
she's achieved control of the Protoform before it took shape." In all 
his centuries of observing he'd never seen anything this amazing. He 
managed to slow the rate of molding but it still wasn't enough. If 
Lunarpine didn't return within a couple of days the process would 
accept the DNA he'd placed in to keep the protoform functioning.


--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, logomorph@h... wrote:
> ::Shadow Wing::
> She tried again to move the arm.  It barely moved up but a half an 
> inch.  She was over joyed that she could at least do something.  
She  
> tried something else.  She tried to move the other arm.  It lifted 
> about two inches off the table.  Her words printed out on the 
> screen< "I DID IT. BY THE MATRIX, I DID IT!"
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> > Alert sirens went off through Veratis' ship, He awoke not 
entirely 
> happy
> > that someone took that moment to visit. He checked the board, 
> movement in
> > the lab, where his protoforms were. "This can't be, how could 
they 
> get
> > inside without my knowing?" he scanned the room, the only life 
sign 
> was
> > Shadow Wings Protoform. "This is amazing" he zoomed in on the pod 
> it was
> > located in, "It Moved without a form, This Shadow Wing is truly a 
> remarkable
> > specimen." He pressed a few more buttons on his console. The DNA 
> he'd
> > programmed it to reject was now somehow being accepted. "I must 
> slow the
> > rate, if she takes this form, theres no telling what changes 
could 
> be made."
